abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Social Protection
            Implementation Project for Macedonia were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory; risk to development
            outcome was moderate; Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory and borrower performance was also moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: the need for
            strong government ownership and subsequent involvement of
            the respective government agencies in the project
            implementation; this played a crucial role in ensuring the
            project's success and sustainability; the need for
            realism and flexibility of the implementation timetable
            supported by project management instruments such as a
            detailed critical path analysis; paying due attention and
            respect to the political economy of the planned pension and
            social assistance reforms through incorporating and
            executing public education campaigns; and completion and
            operational readiness of the project implementation
            arrangements during the project preparation which ensured
            that implementation could start with no delays.

repnme.cdata!:
Macedonia - Social Protection
            Implementation Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Social Protection
            Implementation Project for Macedonia are to improve the
            effectiveness and efficiency of social protection system
            through improved administration and long-term sustainability
            of the pension system and improved targeting and
            administration of cash benefits. The restructuring includes:
            (i) extending the closing date of the loan by eleven months;
            (ii) increasing the disbursement percentage of eligible
            expenditures to 100 percent; and (iii) reallocating funds
            within categories of schedule one of the loan agreement.

display_title.display_title:
Macedonia - Social Protection
            Implementation Project : restructuring : Main report

5146447.trustfund:
TF026815-PHRD-FYR MACEDONIA: SOCIAL
            PROTECTION IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT
5146447.majtheme: Public sector governance,Social protection and risk management

repnme.cdata!:
Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia -
            Social Protection Implementation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Social Protection
            Implementation Project for Macedonia are to improve the
            effectiveness and efficiency of social protection system
            through improved administration and long-term sustainability
            of the pension system and improved targeting and
            administration of cash benefits.  The project includes three
            components: (i) pension system administration; (ii) social
            protection program support; and (iii) project management,
            monitoring and evaluation. The first two components consist
            of multiple subcomponents. Component 1 comprises support for
            governance and management reform in the PDF, the development
            of the pension supervision agency, MLSP capacity building
            for pension system analysis, policy development and public
            education, and pension system custody capacity development
            at the NBRM. Component 2 comprises support for the policy
            framework for streamlined, cost effective and better
            targeted cash benefits, implementation of local social
            planning and deinstitutionalization of social work services,
            and establishment of inspection, supervision and quality
            assurance functions; and information management systems and
            IT capacity strengthening.

Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia -
            Social Protection Implementation Project

Former Yugoslav Republic of
            Macedonia - Social Protection Implementation Project
